Watched glass onion movie:

Nice story of the disruptor-elite class and their shackles to their world that are only breakable when they personally witness the systems falling apart.

Most poignant part: when the black woman started breaking the glass sculptures, everyone was OK with it. some even cheered her on. most elite were fine with it. then the lower elite class started breaking them and had fun and the leader didnâ€™t care. then the woman took it further and the lowers stopped, aghast. the breaking point was the mona lisa. not sure what it signified, but it was the last sacred thing to these people.
